result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shawn A Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shawn A Brown was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

10:15 a.m.  Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt in court via telephone.  Judge Duvall via telephone.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Defendant Shawn A Brown not in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews procedure for non-evidentiary hearings with attorneys regarding non-appearance of Defendant.  O'Sullivan has no objection to Defendant not appearing for today's motion hearing.  Attorney Schoenfeldt addresses the Court.  Attorney O'Sullivan addresses the Court.  Court - reviews post conviction procedures.  Attorney Schoenfeldt addresses the court.  Attorney O'Sullivan addresses the court.  Court summarizes issues at hand.  Attorney O'Sullivan gives argument.  Attorney Schoenfeldt gives argument.  Court - If either attorney has anything further submit it to the court either in letter form or a brief by Thursday, April 7, 2017.  Court will make decision at that time on motion.  11:00 a.m.

9:13 Defendant Shawn A Brown in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorneys and Defendant in the courtroom.  Earlier in court chambers the Judge, Court reporter, attorney's and Defendant were present. Witness list, voir dire and other acts evidence were discussed. 20 jurors are seated in the box. Judge calls the case. All jurors are swn. Judge does voir dire. Atty OSullivan does voire dire. Atty Petersen does voir dire.  Court gives general jury instructions to the jurors. 12 jurors are selected and swn. 9:51 Atty OSullivan requests to take a witness out of order and that Officer Neely we exempt from sequesterian. Court grants that request. 9:53 court recesses. 10:10 Court resumes with Def, counsel and jury present.  Judge gives preliminary jury instructions. Atty OSullivan gives opening statement. Atty Petersen give opening statement.  10:21 Ty Jacobson swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Atty Petersen x ex. 10:29 Officer Jesse Neely swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Exh#1-google map of Prescott: off/rec for demonstrative purposes. Officer Neely ID's Def. 10:41 Jury is excused. Atty Petersen wants the knife not be referenced and gives argument. Atty OSullivan gives argument. Court: leave the knife out of it. 10:49 Jury returns. Atty OSullivan continues ex. Atty Petersen x ex. Exh#2-permission to search form; off/rec. 11:11 Sgt Mark Schulz swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Exh#-plastic bag containing substance found; off/rec.  Court: Exh#3 will be remanded to the custody of Sgt Schulz for chain of custody reasons. Atty OSullivan and Atty Petersen have no objection. Exh#3 was reviewed by the jury and given to Sgt Schulz. 11:23 Jury is excused. Atty Petersen requests testimony of substance be striken and/or clarified to the jury. Could move for a mistrial. Objects to next witness lab anaylist since they hadn't been given the lab results. Exh#4-lab results. Exh#4 was provided to Atty Petersen. Court: any motion relating to the officer testimony is denied. Discovery related problems should have been brought up at the final pre trial and isn't wasnt.  Motion to strike testimony is denied. 11:34 Jury returns. Madison Kinskiern swn, ex by Atty OSullivan. Exh#5-labatory receive receipt; off/rec. Exh#4; off/rec. Atty Petersen x ex. 11:50 Jury is excused. Atty Petersen addresses Def potentially testifying. Court: open to matters and x ex by Atty OSullivan. Court has no objection to Sgt Schulz leaving with evidence. 12:49 Counsel and Defendant are present. Atty Petersen renews her motion to suppress evidence based on Officer Neely's testimony of stop. Court addresses the Def of his rights to testifying or not testifying.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Atty OSullivan addresses line of questioning. Atty Petersen responds. 12:54 Jury is present. Defendant Shawn Brown swn, ex by Atty Petersen. Exh#6-hand drawing of car seat; off/rec. Atty OSullivan x ex. Petersen redirect. OSullivan re x ex. 1:21 Jesse Neely retakes the stand, OSullivan redirect. Court: testimony is completed. 1:24 Jury is excused. Court reviews jury instructions and verdict forms. Proposed Instructions: 100,110,145,6030,140,190,300, 148, 160, 484, 515,525. OSullivan has no objections or changes. Atty Petersen responds. Court goes over verdict forms. Counsel has no objection. 1:34 Jury is present. Court goes over the jury instructions with the jury. 1:45 Atty OSullivan gives closing argument. 1:51 Atty Petersen gives closing argument. 2:00 Atty OSullivan gives rebuttal. Court instructs jury on deliberation and verdict. Baliff's are swn. 2:06 jury is excused for deliberation. Court releases Exh#3 to Sgt Schulz to keep as evidence until the DA tells him otherwise. Petersen reissues her motion to suppress; get a transcript and rule on at a later date. . OSullivan objects. 2:45 Defendant, counsel and jury is present. Court resumes. Jury has reached a verdict.  The jury finds the Defendant guilty of the charge of possession of methamphetamine. Court polls the jury and each juror affirms the verdict. Court finds the Def guilty of the charge based on the guilty verdict. 2:49 Court excuses the jury. Atty OSullivan requests a PSI. Court orders a PSI. Set the sentencing 60 days out. Bond to continue.

11:51 Defendant Shawn A Brown in court with attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Petersen requests witness be sequestored.Court orders sequestration.  Officer Jesse Neely is sw and ex by OSullivan Witness ID's the defendant. Atty Peterson X-exams Officer Neely.  Exh #1 Map of Prescott.  Exh 1 is offered and received.  Exh 2 Officer Neely's report  Offered. - Court does not receive because only a portion of the report was used to impeach the witness - not the whole report.  Court examines Officer Neely.  O'Sullivan does follow-up.  Peterson calls Officer Mark R. Schultz.  Officer Schultz is sworn.  Peterson examines Officer Schultz.  Brown is swn, ex by Petersen. OSullivan x ex. Peterson redirect. OSullivan gives argument. Atty Petersen gives argument. Court: finds officer credible that the car did not come to complete stop. Def was not under arrest for the possession of the switchblade. Officer did not unreasonably extend the stop and detain the Defendant. Once citations are issued and handed to the defendant the traffic stop is complete. Motion is denied.  Exh#2 will remain in the record.
